newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RBA says no tightening if trade deficit worsens.
newsitem.headline: RBA says no tightening if trade deficit worsens.

text.p: Reserve Bank of Australia Governor Ian Macfarlane said on Thursday that the central bank would not tighten monetary policy if the economy expanded to grow at four percent and the balance of payments worsened.
"We don't tighten or loosen monetary policy because of the balance of payments," Macfarlane told a parliamentary hearing.
"Sometimes we have tightened monetary policy and the balance of payments has been deteriorating, but that is because the economy has been growing too fast," he said.

"If the economy was growing at four percent, which we regard as being entirely sustainable, but the balance of payments was worsening, we would not regard that as a case for tightening monetary policy."
